content:
TITLE: Defining Entities with YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines the structure of a simple Pokemon app, including the entities `Pokemon` and `Trainer`. It specifies the properties for each entity, such as name, type, and level for Pokemon, and name and isChampion for Trainer. The `belongsTo` relationship indicates that a Pokemon belongs to a Trainer.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
name: Pokemon app üê£

entities:
  Pokemon üêâ:
    properties:
      - name
      - { name: type,
          type: choice,
          options: { values: [Fire, Water, Grass, Electric] }
        }
      - { name: level, type: number }
    belongsTo:
      - Trainer

  Trainer üßë‚Äçüé§:
    properties:
      - name
      - { name: isChampion, type: boolean }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initialize Manifest SDK in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to import and initialize the Manifest JavaScript SDK within a JavaScript project. It creates a new instance of the Manifest class, which can then be used to interact with the Manifest platform.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/js-sdk/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
import Manifest from @mnfst/sdk

// Initialize client.
const manifest = new Manifest()
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: YAML Entity Definition
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet defines two entities, 'Pokemon' and 'Trainer', and their associated properties. The Pokemon entity has properties for name, type (a choice between Fire, Water, Grass, Electric), and level (a number). The Trainer entity has properties for name and isChampion (a boolean). Pokemon belongs to Trainer, establishing a relationship.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/core/manifest/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: YAML
CODE:
```
name: Pokemon app üê£

entities:
  Pokemon üêâ:
    properties:
      - name
      - {
          name: type,
          type: choice,
          options: { values: [Fire, Water, Grass, Electric] }
        }
      - { name: level, type: number }
    belongsTo:
      - Trainer

  Trainer üßë‚Äçüé§:
    properties:
      - name
      - { name: isChampion, type: boolean }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Manifest SDK using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the Manifest JavaScript SDK as a dependency in your project using npm. It allows you to then import and use the SDK's functionalities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/js-sdk/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npm i @mnfst/sdk
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Manifest with npx
DESCRIPTION: This bash command is used to install the Manifest package locally using npx.  `npx` allows you to run packages directly without globally installing them. `add-manifest@latest` will fetch and execute the latest version of the `add-manifest` package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npx add-manifest@latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding Manifest to Project using npx
DESCRIPTION: This command adds Manifest to your project using the `npx` command to execute the latest version of the `add-manifest` package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/add-manifest/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx add-manifest@latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the project's dependencies using npm (Node Package Manager). It reads the `package.json` file to identify and download the required packages.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/add-manifest/assets/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies for Manifest
DESCRIPTION: These commands install the necessary dependencies for the Manifest project. The first command installs the regular dependencies, and the second installs dependencies for all workspaces within the project. This ensures that all parts of the project have their required dependencies installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install
npm install --workspaces
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies and Running Manifest (npm)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install the necessary dependencies for the Manifest project using `npm i` and then how to run the manifest application itself using `npm run manifest`. This will start the development server, and the user can then access the admin panel and REST API documentation in their browser.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/main-demo/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i
npm run manifest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for the Manifest project using npm (Node Package Manager). It fetches and installs all packages listed in the project's package.json file. Ensure Node.js and npm are installed before running this command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/auth/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for the Manifest project using npm. It is a prerequisite for running the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/collections/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for the Manifest project using npm. It retrieves and installs all packages listed in the package.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/storage/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing dependencies using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the project dependencies listed in the package.json file using the npm package manager. It is a prerequisite for running the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/validation/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Manifest dependencies
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the necessary dependencies for the Manifest project using npm. It is a prerequisite for running the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/relations/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Manifest Package
DESCRIPTION: This command installs the Manifest package using npm. It's a necessary first step before running or developing with the Manifest project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/singles/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ npm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Manifest Application
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Manifest application in development mode using the `manifest` script defined in the package.json file. It typically launches a development server, enabling features like hot reloading and debugging tools. It requires the dependencies installed by `npm install` to be present.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/auth/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up development environment
DESCRIPTION: These commands set up a local development environment. First, install dependencies using `npm install`. Then, create a test folder, navigate into it, and run the development script from the parent directory to test changes without affecting project files.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/add-manifest/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install

# Run from a test folder to prevent messing with project files.
mkdir test-folder
cd test-folder
../bin/dev.js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding Dummy Data (npm)
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to seed dummy data into the Manifest project using the command `npm manifest:seed`. This command will delete any existing data before seeding the new data.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/main-demo/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm manifest:seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Manifest in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Manifest application in development mode. It typically watches for file changes and automatically reloads the application, providing a fast feedback loop during development. The application will be accessible at localhost:1111.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/add-manifest/assets/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Manifest in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Manifest application in development mode. It uses npm to execute the 'manifest' script, typically defined in the project's package.json file. This mode usually includes features like hot-reloading and detailed error messages for development purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/collections/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Manifest in development mode
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Manifest application in development mode using npm. It enables hot reloading and exposes the admin UI and REST API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/relations/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Manifest in Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Manifest application in development mode. It typically watches for file changes and automatically reloads the application, facilitating rapid development cycles.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/storage/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Manifest app in development mode
DESCRIPTION: This command runs the Manifest application in development mode using the npm package manager. It starts the development server and enables features like hot reloading. The application will be accessible at http://localhost:1111.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/validation/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Manifest in Development
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Manifest application in development mode using npm. This allows for hot-reloading and debugging during development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/singles/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install Manifest using npx
DESCRIPTION: This bash command installs the latest version of Manifest using npx.  It allows you to quickly add Manifest to your project without requiring a global installation. The command should be run from the root directory of your project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/core/manifest/README.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npx add-manifest@latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Install and Start Admin Panel JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: These commands install the necessary dependencies and start the Manifest admin panel application. It assumes that Node.js and npm are already installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/core/admin/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
npm install
npm run start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Run Manifest SDK Sandbox Environment
DESCRIPTION: These commands set up and run a local development environment using the `/sandbox` folder, which contains a minimal React app that imports the Manifest SDK. The first command navigates to the sandbox directory, the second installs the necessary dependencies, and the third starts the development server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/js-sdk/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
cd sandbox
npm install
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running the Manifest Development Server
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the development server for the Manifest project. It is essential for local development and testing, allowing developers to see their changes in real-time. This command assumes that the necessary dependencies have already been installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding Dummy Data for Manifest Entities
DESCRIPTION: This command populates the application's database with dummy data. It is useful for testing and development purposes, allowing developers to quickly populate the application with sample content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/add-manifest/assets/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest:seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding Dummy Data
DESCRIPTION: This command populates the database with dummy data for entities using the `manifest:seed` script.  This is useful for testing and development purposes, providing a pre-filled database to work with. It assumes the Manifest application and associated database are set up correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/auth/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest:seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding Dummy Data with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command populates the application's database with dummy data. It uses npm to execute the 'manifest:seed' script, which is defined in the project's package.json file. This is helpful for testing and development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/collections/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest:seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding Manifest with dummy data
DESCRIPTION: This command seeds the Manifest application with dummy data using npm. It populates the entities with sample data for testing and development purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/relations/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest:seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding Dummy Data with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command seeds the Manifest application with dummy data. It populates the database with sample records for development and testing purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/storage/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest:seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding dummy data using npm
DESCRIPTION: This command seeds the application with dummy data for testing and development purposes. It is executed using the npm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/validation/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest:seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding Dummy Data
DESCRIPTION: This command seeds the Manifest application with dummy data using npm. This is useful for testing and development purposes to populate the database with sample content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/examples/website/singles/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run manifest:seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Publishing the Manifest package
DESCRIPTION: These commands build and publish the Manifest package to npm. First, build the package using `npm run build`. Then, publish the package using `npm publish`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/add-manifest/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run build
npm publish
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Seeding the Manifest Database
DESCRIPTION: This command seeds the Manifest database with initial data, including an admin user and dummy data. This is crucial for setting up the application and testing its functionalities, especially the admin panel and API. It requires the development server to be running.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run seed
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running End-to-End Tests with npm
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the end-to-end tests for the Manifest package using npm.  It assumes that the npm package manager is installed and configured, and that a `test:e2e` script is defined in the `package.json` file. The output will vary depending on the test suite configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/core/manifest/e2e/README.md#_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run test:e2e
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Test Manifest using npm
DESCRIPTION: These bash commands are used to test the Manifest application. 'npm run test' runs the standard tests, while 'npm run test:e2e' executes the end-to-end tests. These commands require npm to be installed and configured for the project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/packages/core/manifest/README.md#_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: Bash
CODE:
```
npm run test
npm run test:e2e
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Manifest Tests
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the test suite for the Manifest project. It is crucial for ensuring the quality and stability of the codebase. Running tests helps in identifying and preventing regressions during development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/mnfst/manifest/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run test
```
